newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-ABARE sees Australia aluminium output up.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-ABARE sees Australia aluminium output up.

text.p: Australia's production of aluminium is forecast to rise to 1.5 million tonnes in 1997/98 (July-June) from an estimated 1.4 million tonnes in 1996/97, the Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics (ABARE) said in its latest Commodities bulletin.

The expectations for higher output reflect increased capacity utilisation at Australian smelters, particularly the mid-1997 commissioning of a 220,000 tonne potline at the Boyne island smelter, ABARE said in the March quarter report.
Comalco Ltd owns 50 percent of the existing Boyne Island smelter and will hold a 59.25 percent interest in the third potline.

Cutbacks in capacity utilisation at the refineries of Alcoa World Alumina, a joint venture between Aluminium Co of America (60 percent) and WMC Ltd (40 percent) are forecast to result in Australian alumina production falling slightly to 47,000 tonnes in 1996/97, ABARE said.
Production is expected to respond to improving prices and increase to 13.6 million tonnes in 1997/98, ABARE said.

Aluminium export earnings are forecast to fall 11 percent to A$2.1 billion in 1996/97 as the positive effect of a forecast 3.4 percent increase in the volume of Australian exports is negated by lower world prices and a stronger Australian currency, ABARE said.
An 11 percent rise in exports of primary aluminium 1997/98 are expected to lift export earnings to A$2.7 billion in 1997/98, it said.
